intro: Chaetogastra callichaeta, commonly known as the hairy-leaved chaetogastra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy foliage and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. Native to southern Africa, it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are densely covered in fine hairs. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact growth and attractive floral display.
